Dear Ms. Ahart:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
August 10, 2022. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It
should be noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also violations of
the MISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of
this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MSA citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular license will be issued. If
you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action will result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (248) 860-0787.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules
except for the following:
R 400.12509 Independent living record.
(3) The case record shall contain all of the following information
and documentation, which shall be recorded within 30 calendar
days after placement in independent living and updated at least
once every 90 calendar days:
(o) Service plans as required in R 400.12419 and R
400.12420. If the youth has biological children, the service plan
must address the living arrangement for the child or children,
visitation/parenting time with the youth's biological children or a
clear explanation why this is not possible or appropriate.
Three of four open youth records reviewed did not show
documentation of a required 30 day modified service plan.
Additionally, one of five updated service plans reviewed was
completed two days late.
Repeat Violation- Interim 2021.
R 400.12511 Independent living contract.
(1) When an agency terminates its independent living services
for a youth, the agency shall document all of the following
information in the case record within 30 calendar days of
termination of its services:
(c) A summary of the services provided during care and the
needs that remain to be met.
(d) Provision for any follow-up services.
(c):
Two of three closed youth records reviewed did not show
documentation of (c) as required by this subrule.
(d):
One of three closed youth records reviewed did not show
documentation of (d) as required by this subrule.
4

R 400.12511 Independent living contract.
(2) An agency shall ensure and document that each youth who
ends independent living is provided with all of the following:
(a) Basic information about health, housing, counseling/mental
health services, and emergency resources.
(b) A birth certificate.
(c) A social security card.
(d) The youth's funds and personal property.
One of three closed youth records reviewed did not show
documentation of (a)-(d) as required by the rule.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that
there are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1.
The facility is in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements except for the
following:
None at this time.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract violation. Please note
that there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS
Contract/Policy requirements except for the following:
722-6B Family Team Meeting
FTMs should include child welfare staff, parents, caretakers,
foster parents, children, youth, and may also include extended
family, friends, neighbors, community-based service providers,
community representatives, tribal representatives, for Indian
children, or other professionals involved with the family.
Each meeting must be documented in MiSACWIS using the FTM
hyperlink and all of the appropriate forms must be completed for
each type of meeting.
Certain circumstances, events, and/or stages of case progression
mandate FTMs must occur within the required time frames as
outlined in the following tables…
Case Plan Development/ Reassessment.
One of four open youth records reviewed showed:
 This youth’s 1/3/2022- 4/1/2022 and 4/2/2022-6/29/2022
service plans did not show documentation of an FTM for
the respective periods.

 Additionally, a DHS-1105 FTM report was not documented
for a 1/11/2022 FTM indicated for this youth.
Repeat Violation- Interim 2021
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
Policy 722-15 Case closing discharge documents
 The agency was apprised it shall consistently and clearly show
documentation it provided the youth a copy of the youth’s medical passport.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
IL+Contract-2.10. d.9) A minimum of 4 hours of IL instruction
 I reviewed an instruction log the agency is developing to show verification
of this requirement; and I provided recommendations.
EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
AND
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
The corrective action plan related to the agency’s 2021 Interim inspection, where it
received the following citations:
 R400.12202(1)(g)-Policy and procedures.
 R400.12509(3)(o). Independent living record.
 722-6B-Family team meeting.
 722-9-Foster care updated service plan- Supervisory approval.
 Contract IL+1.1b-Continuing eligibility criteria.
The agency made progress on the corrective action plan but were not completely
successful with all. It received two repeat violations this renewal inspection, as
indicated in the report.
VI. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon
receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility will
be issued a renewal of their regular license.
